content: The Act titled "Fair Access to Credit Scores Act of 2016" mandates the inclusion of credit scores in free annual disclosures. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose current credit scores in free annual disclosures. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose current credit scores in free annual disclosures, along with other relevant consumer information for financial education purposes. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose credit scores in free annual disclosures for consumer education. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose credit scores and risk scores in free annual disclosures for consumer education. This includes definitions for credit score and risk score, which are numerical values used to predict credit behaviors and behaviors/outcomes based on consumer report information. Maintenance of credit scores is also addressed. Consumer reporting agencies must maintain credit scores or risk scores in a consumer's file for at least 1 year. Additionally, agencies must provide a credit score without charge to the consumer upon request for a free annual disclosure.
